intro: Spiraea tomentosa f. alba, commonly known as white meadow spiraea, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to the northern regions of North America. It features small, white flowers that bloom in early summer, typically in clusters along the stems. The plant has a dense, rounded growth habit with grayish-white, fuzzy foliage that adds texture to the landscape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows and along streambanks. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
